description:
11.17 blurdetect
Determines blurriness of frames without altering the input frames.

Based on Marziliano, Pina, et al. "A no-reference perceptual blur metric."
Allows for a block-based abbreviation.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: blurdetect

options.description:
Set low and high threshold values used by the Canny thresholding algorithm.

The high threshold selects the "strong" edge pixels, which are then connected through 8-connectivity with the "weak" edge pixels selected by the low threshold.

low and high threshold values must be chosen in the range [0,1], and low should be lesser or equal to high.

Default value for low is 20/255, and default value for high is 50/255.
options.name: high

options.description:
Set low and high threshold values used by the Canny thresholding algorithm.

The high threshold selects the "strong" edge pixels, which are then connected through 8-connectivity with the "weak" edge pixels selected by the low threshold.

low and high threshold values must be chosen in the range [0,1], and low should be lesser or equal to high.

Default value for low is 20/255, and default value for high is 50/255.
options.name: low

options.description: Define the radius to search around an edge pixel for local maxima.
options.name: radius

options.description: Determine blurriness only for the most significant blocks, given in percentage.
options.name: block_pct

options.description: Determine blurriness for blocks of width block_width. If set to any value smaller 1, no blocks are used and the whole image is processed as one no matter of block_height.
options.name: block_width

options.description: Determine blurriness for blocks of height block_height. If set to any value smaller 1, no blocks are used and the whole image is processed as one no matter of block_width.
options.name: block_height

options.description: Set planes to filter. Default is first only.
options.name: planes
